questions.question_text: If (x/3 + 1, y - 2/3) = (5/3, 1/3), find the values of x and y.
hints: Equate corresponding components of ordered pairs

questions.question_text: If the set A has 3 elements and the set B = {3, 4, 5}, then find the number of elements in (A × B).
hints: Use formula n(A × B) = n(A) × n(B)

questions.question_text: If G = {7, 8} and H = {5, 4, 2}, find G × H and H × G.
hints: Note order matters in cartesian product

questions.question_text: State whether each of the following statements are true or false. If the statement is false, rewrite the given statement correctly. (i) If P = {m, n} and Q = {n, m}, then P × Q = {(m, n), (n, m)}. (ii) If A and B are non-empty sets, then A × B is a non-empty set of ordered pairs (x, y) such that x ∈ A and y ∈ B. (iii) If A = {1, 2}, B = {3, 4}, then A × (B ∩ φ) = φ.
If A = {–1, 1}, find A × A × A.
If A × B = {(a, x), (a, y), (b, x), (b, y)}. Find A and B.
Let A = {1, 2}, B = {1, 2, 3, 4}, C = {5, 6} and D = {5, 6, 7, 8}. Verify that (i) A × (B ∩ C) = (A × B) ∩ (A × C). (ii) A × C is a subset of B × D.
Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. Write A × B. How many subsets will A × B have? List them.
hints: Number of subsets = 2^n where n = number of elements
List all subsets including empty set

questions.question_text: Let A and B be two sets such that n(A) = 3 and n(B) = 2. If (x, 1), (y, 2), (z, 1) are in A × B, find A and B, where x, y and z are distinct elements.
hints: From ordered pairs, deduce elements of A and B
Check cardinality matches given n(A) and n(B)

questions.question_text: The Cartesian product A × A has 9 elements among which are found (–1, 0) and (0, 1). Find the set A and the remaining elements of A × A.
hints: From given pairs, deduce elements of A

questions.question_text: Let A = {1, 2, 3, ..., 14}. Define a relation R from A to A by R = {(x, y) : 3x – y = 0, where x, y ∈ A}. Write down its domain, codomain and range.
hints: Find pairs where both x and y are in A
Domain = set of first elements, Range = set of second elements

questions.question_text: Define a relation R on the set N of natural numbers by R = {(x, y) : y = x + 5, x is a natural number less than 4; x, y ∈ N}. Depict this relationship using roster form. Write down the domain and the range.
A = {1, 2, 3, 5} and B = {4, 6, 9}. Define a relation R from A to B by R = {(x, y): the difference between x and y is odd; x ∈ A, y ∈ B}. Write R in roster form.
hints: Check |x - y| is odd for each combination

questions.question_text: The Fig 2.7 shows a relationship between the sets P and Q. Write this relation (i) in set-builder form (ii) roster form. What is its domain and range?
Let A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 6}. Let R be the relation on A defined by {(a, b): a, b ∈ A, b is exactly divisible by a}. (i) Write R in roster form (ii) Find the domain of R (iii) Find the range of R.
hints: b should be multiple of a

questions.question_text: Determine the domain and range of the relation R defined by R = {(x, x + 5) : x ∈ {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5}}.
Write the relation R = {(x, x^3) : x is a prime number less than 10} in roster form.
Let A = {x, y, z} and B = {1, 2}. Find the number of relations from A to B.
Let R be the relation on Z defined by R = {(a, b): a, b ∈ Z, a – b is an integer}. Find the domain and range of R.
hints: a - b is always integer for integers a, b
Relation includes all pairs of integers

questions.question_text: Which of the following relations are functions? Give reasons. If it is a function, determine its domain and range. (i) {(2,1), (5,1), (8,1), (11,1), (14,1), (17,1)} (ii) {(2,1), (4,2), (6,3), (8,4), (10,5), (12,6), (14,7)} (iii) {(1,3), (1,5), (2,5)}.
hints: Check each first element appears only once

questions.question_text: Find the domain and range of the following real functions: (i) f(x) = –|x| (ii) f(x) = √(9 – x^2).
hints: (i) |x| defined for all real x, so domain = R; range: f(x) ≤ 0
(ii) 9 - x^2 ≥ 0 for real output, solve inequality

questions.question_text: A function f is defined by f(x) = 2x – 5. Write down the values of (i) f(0), (ii) f(7), (iii) f(–3).

The function 't' which maps temperature in degree Celsius into temperature in degree Fahrenheit is defined by t(C) = (9C/5) + 32. Find (i) t(0) (ii) t(28) (iii) t(–10) (iv) The value of C, when t(C) = 212.
Find the range of each of the following functions. (i) f(x) = 2 – 3x, x ∈ R, x > 0. (ii) f(x) = x^2 + 2, x is a real number. (iii) f(x) = x, x is a real number.
The relation f is defined by f(x) = { x^2, 0 ≤ x ≤ 3; 3x, 3 ≤ x ≤ 10 }. The relation g is defined by g(x) = { x^2, 0 ≤ x ≤ 2; 3x, 2 ≤ x ≤ 10 }. Show that f is a function and g is not a function.
hints: Check at overlapping x values: for f, at x=3 both rules give same value 9
For g, at x=2, rules give 4 and 6 (two images)

questions.question_text: Find the domain of the function f(x) = (x^2 + 2x + 1) / (x^2 – 8x + 12).
Find the domain and the range of the real function f defined by f(x) = √(x – 1).
Find the domain and the range of the real function f defined by f(x) = |x – 1|.
Let f = { (x, x^2/(1+x^2)) : x ∈ R } be a function from R into R. Determine the range of f.
hints: Solve for x^2 in terms of y
Since x^2 ≥ 0, get condition on y

questions.question_text: Let f, g : R → R be defined, respectively by f(x) = x + 1, g(x) = 2x – 3. Find f + g, f – g and f/g.
Let f = {(1,1), (2,3), (0,–1), (–1, –3)} be a function from Z to Z defined by f(x) = ax + b, for some integers a, b. Determine a, b.
hints: Use two points to form equations
Solve system for a and b

questions.question_text: Let R be a relation from N to N defined by R = {(a, b) : a, b ∈ N and a = b^2}. Are the following true? (i) (a,a) ∈ R, for all a ∈ N (ii) (a,b) ∈ R, implies (b,a) ∈ R (iii) (a,b) ∈ R, (b,c) ∈ R implies (a,c) ∈ R. Justify your answer in each case.
hints: (i) Check if a = a^2 for all natural numbers
(ii) If a = b^2, is b = a^2?
(iii) If a = b^2 and b = c^2, is a = c^2?

questions.question_text: Let A = {1,2,3,4}, B = {1,5,9,11,15,16} and f = {(1,5), (2,9), (3,1), (4,5), (2,11)}. Are the following true? (i) f is a relation from A to B (ii) f is a function from A to B. Justify your answer in each case.
hints: (i) Check if all pairs have first element in A, second in B
(ii) Check if any first element repeats with different second element

questions.question_text: Let f be the subset of Z × Z defined by f = {(ab, a + b) : a, b ∈ Z}. Is f a function from Z to Z? Justify your answer.
hints: Check if same first element (ab) can come from different (a,b) giving different a+b

questions.question_text: Let A = {9,10,11,12,13} and let f : A → N be defined by f(n) = the highest prime factor of n. Find the range of f.
hints: Compute highest prime factor for each n in A
